TopicTitle: Mun Base clipped through the Mun

Articles.Content:
So, I've got this Mun base, all of the components of which have "sunk" about 12 meters 'into' the Mun. I've tried loading the quicksave, reloading the entire game, etc. I'm thinking now that I'll have to edit the save file for the first time. My question is about which values I would be editing. If I'm looking to recover the base by putting it back on the surface, would I be modifying the "alt" value of the VESSEL or the "hgt" value? Or what? Any suggestions on fixing this?

It's possible that all of the landed on the items on the Mun have shifted; a flag on the opposite side of the Mun is floating above the surface...

Any help is appreciated. Thanks!

Edited February 5, 2014 by PUNiSH3R

QUCKSAVE BEFORE YOU TRY THIS!!!!

Lock the suspension on all your landing gear, retract all legs, deploy all legs.

QUCKSAVE BEFORE YOU TRY THIS!!!!

Lock the suspension on all your landing gear, retract all legs, deploy all legs.

Nothing, but I can't toggle the suspension to lock, as I just discovered I cannot control anything; it's reacting like I'm warped but I'm not... I can't toggle the gear via the keyboard ("g") but I can hit the HUD button and the gear will toggle.
I'm an idiot; I switched "Terrain Detail" from Default to Low. Switching it back fixed the problem.
Glad you fixed it, not sure about your control issue.
